International Directors Program: Developing Effective Directors In a Global Context

The International Directors Program is INSEAD's flagship course in corporate governance and is a unique educational experience that develops effective directors. Today’s supervisory boards have to contend with a host of new pressures, challenges and risks in addition to evaluating the performance of the CEO and senior executives. They must therefore set the company’s strategic direction, often across diverse product markets and geographies, and monitor the firm’s risk profile.The program offers practical and tested frameworks and tools to sharpen judgment and decision-making skills. It also augments the oversight abilities of directors seeking to boost their existing competencies or to be better prepared for new board mandates. The focus is to master strategies for the following fundamental areas: board effectiveness and dynamics; board decision-making and oversight; and director effectiveness and development.https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=4&v=BLjPYdVXgmw

Even with sophisticated models of risk exposure in place, companies are becoming more vulnerable to sudden geopolitical crises, natural disasters, and competitive threats. This intensive program provided the frameworks Directors need to reassess and strengthen your company's approach to risk management. You learn how to develop winning strategies that balance innovation and risk, prepare for the consequences that result from "novel risks," and sustain a long-term competitive advantage.

The Program on Negotiation at Harvard Law School (PON) is a world-renowned interdisciplinary center on negotiation and conflict resolution. Drawing from numerous fields of study, including law, business, government, psychology, economics, anthropology, and education, PON works to connect rigorous research and scholarship with a deep understanding of practice.http://www.pon.harvard.edu/about.phpFounded and based at Harvard Law School, PON is a consortium of faculty, students, and staff at Harvard University, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Tufts University, and other Boston-area schools.

summary: Manage the strategy and overall business direction of Afilias -- help shape the company's strategic vision and tactical direction.  Lead company through successful acquisitions and expansion through M&As - including successful integration of new teams without a loss of cultural and ethical values.Ram has been instrumental in identifying and developing policies that affect Internet users today and in the future through his work with various Internet standards groups.Selected by the Philadelphia Business Journal as one of the region's top up-and-coming business leaders, Ram was the recepient of the '40 Under 40' award in 2003.Experienced in leveraging technology for business advantage and market leadership.  Built technology, product management and delivery teams from the ground up, running on first-generation or n-generation technology, each with special challenges.Ram serves as an advisor to startup firms, and entrepreneurs who have an idea but are figuring out how to make it reality.Ram serves on the Board of ICANN, the global non-profit organization that provides technical coordination of the Internet's names and number resources, as well as on the Board of several startup companies in the Internet technology sector.Specialties: Operational management, technology architecture, team building, leadership through change, M&A.  Experienced Executive, Innovator, Startup Adviser, Technology Architect
name: Ram Mohan
title: Executive Vice President, CTO at Afilias
